description: Rich Abromeit, left, and Jason Smith are owners of Montana Advanced Caregivers in Billings, Montana. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
Rich Abromeit reminisces about growing marijuana in high school with his friend, Jason Smith. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
"AK-47," one of the many marijuana strains grown by Montana Advanced Caregivers, is marked and labeled with white duct tape. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
Jason Smith tends to his plants by watering marijuana seedlings, which is the next stage after germination. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
A Montana Advanced Caregivers employee trims the "sugar leaves," which are often covered with THC crystals, off of a recently harvested marijuana plant. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
After harvesting, Montana Advanced Caregivers employee Zachary Wilson works to trim the buds, getting rid of unwanted leaves. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
Cleaning off scissors, a Montana Advanced Caregivers employee scrapes off the residue left on the scissors used to trim marijuana buds. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
Display cases at Montana Advanced Caregivers house jars containing different varieties of marijuana. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
Montana Advanced Caregivers manager Josh Thill weighs marijuana while he writes a receipt for employee and patient, Zachary Wilson. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
Nearing the end of business hours, Montana Advanced Caregivers employee and patient Zachary Wilson heads home for the day. (Photo by Martin do Nascimento | News 21)
